sub_title: Behavioral Scientist | Postdoctoral Researcher | Maastricht University School of Business and Economics
summary:
I am viciously curious to find out what people (cognitively) do, far beyond what they think they do. 

“The conscious brain thinks it’s the Oval Office, but it is actually the Press room” 
                                                                                                                        -	Jonathan Haidt

“What gets us into trouble is not what we don't know. It's what we know for sure that just ain't so.”
                                                                                                                        -	Mark Twain

Research
As a researcher at Maastricht University, I have found joy in balancing the challenging cord of multidisciplinary research. Functioning as behavioral economist in the Real Estate group, I currently investigate the behavioral impact of crisis on policy and performance.. I am able to do so thanks to my degrees in Psychology and Behavioral Economics as well as additional training in (Sustainable) Finance, Marketing, and Econometrics. 

Teaching
Being an adamant believer of letting nothing go to waste, I put my degree in Education to work, making sure students in my courses are motivated, knowledgeable, and eager. A low threshold for approachability and a high bar concerning expected performance characterizes my teaching style. The willing will be able. 
 
Community
Finally, I am a strong believer (and the living evidence) that research is not solely for genius people.  As such, I am the proud organizer of the SBE Science Slam, in which young aspiring researchers present their research in a fun and relaxed off-campus setting to an unknowledgeable audience.

Specialties:  Cognitive and Social Psychology, Decision Science, Human Behavior, Marketing, Consumer Psychology, Biases and Heuristics, Behavioral Economics, Education and Training, Project Management, Statistics (STATA and SPSS), Cooperation and Coordination, Creativity. 
Bonus: Mad Google Skills and Humor (debatable)

treasury_media.title: Academic Portfolio
treasury_media.description: My research varies across multiple topics, with the same recurring theme: investigating the inaccuracy of human judgment, factors that unconsciously influence resulting decisions, and the unawareness of that influence. I use lab and online experiments to explore the behavioral side of many real-life, relevant, economic and societal problems.

profile_positions.company: Maastricht University School of Business and Economics
profile_positions.description:
As the organiser of the first edition of HealthBuild2022, I spearheaded the international conference aimed to connect industry, policy, and research on the impact of buildings on their occupants. We succeeded with 100+ attendees, 25+ international speakers, and many great connections made.

Speakers included keynotes by Harvard Business School and WELL institute. 

While we shape our buildings, our buildings in turn shape us: the indoor environment in which we work, learn, play and live affect our health, productivity, and wellbeing. HealthBuild 2022 will bring together Europe’s experts on this issue, providing a fertile mix of academic knowledge and industry experience.
profile_positions.title: Conference Organisator HealthBuild2022

profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.company: Maastricht University School of Business and Economics
profile_positions.description:
The PhD Science Slam aims to strengthen the connection between academia and the outside world, and provides future academics with a platform in which they are confronted with an unknowledgeable audience. Presenters train their presentation skills in a popular and accessible way, ensuring optimal dissemination of their own valuable research. 

Since my appointment to be head responsible for further development and organisation, the Science Slam has double in size and tripled in budget. We currently host 4 presenters per Slam, for a growing audience of currently around 100 guests. 

Working with the approval of the SBE Dean, GSBE Director, and UM recor, the current aim is to extend the dissemination of knowledge by including different faculties.
profile_positions.title: Event Organizer SBE Science Slam
